terms.description: HyperText Markup Language is the standard markup language for creating web pages and web applications. It describes the structure of web pages using markup.

Cascading Style Sheets is a style sheet language used for describing the presentation of a document written in HTML. CSS describes how elements should be rendered on screen, on paper, in speech, or on other media.
JavaScript is a high-level, interpreted programming language that conforms to the ECMAScript specification. JavaScript enables interactive web pages and is an essential part of web applications.
A design approach aimed at crafting sites to provide an optimal viewing experience across a wide range of devices, from mobile phones to desktop computer monitors.
Application Programming Interface is a set of functions and procedures allowing the creation of applications that access the features or data of an operating system, application, or other service.
